docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: FOR more than a decade, a highly regarded researcher has struggled alone to convince others that his audacious theory of how drugs act is worth testing on humans. His theory, based on extensive studies with animals, is that a even a single dose of drugs that act on the brain can have long-lasting effects that increase with the passage of time.

headline.main: Researcher Gains Support for Test of Novel Theory of Drugs and the Brain
